page.description: Read bytes from socket into string.
page.syntax: Data as C = Read([N Length [, N Timeout ]])

argument.name: Data
argument.description: The data delivered by the connection.

argument.name: Length
argument.description: The maximum number of bytes to read.

argument.name: Timeout
argument.description: The number of milliseconds of inactivity before generating a timeout error.

page.discussion: The .READ() method reads up to Number_of_Bytes bytes of character data from a socket. The amount of data returned may be smaller than Number_of_Bytes if there is less than Number_of_Bytes bytes of data to be read. This will happen if the socket has not received at least Number_of_Bytes bytes of data from the remote connection, either because it did not send that much or because it has not yet traversed the network. If a timeout occurs, .READ()generates an A5SOCKETTIMEOUT error and an ON ERROR GOTO trap can be used to take an appropriate action.
